content: this halter top is a collaboration between betty mcknit and jacq of yarns the elegant design is worked in one piece with no seams it is made to measure and designed to fit busts up to 60 inches 90cm and beyond offering plenty of support through a thick strap embedded into the fabric as opposed to attaching a new yarn to the finished piece and optional shaping for fuller busts row are worked along 3 sides of the granny square to form the neckline next the strap is created with foundation single crochets and worked in the round the rest of the top is worked in row to achieve the right length and width of the top before a delicate baby scalloped edge is added to complete the piece there are two versions of this pattern the 5-petal flower granny square and the 6-day granny square **materials needed** -------------------- yarn in 2 contrasting colors fingering - light worsted weight recommended #2-4 * flower color ~50 yds or 40 m * main color * overbust up to 36 - 300-500y/275-460m * 36-46 - 456-650y/411-640m * 46 -56 - 600-800y/550-732m * 56 + 800-1000y/7332-914m * lighter yarns will require more yardage while heavier weight yarns will require less * optionally mix different color yarns for a striped or scrappy effect hook needed to achieve desired gauge if in doubt use the suggested hook for your yarn stitch markers needle to weave in ends
